refnamediv.refpurpose: find matches of a string in a vector of strings

refsynopsisdiv.title: Syntax
refsynopsisdiv.synopsis: row = grep(haystack, needle ) [row, which] = grep(haystack, needle ) row = grep(haystack, needle, [flag]) [row, which] = grep(haystack, needle, [flag])

listitem.para: a row vector of character strings.
a character string or a row vector of character strings. The string(s) to search in haystack.
a vector of indices: row where a match has been found or an empty matrix if no match found.
a vector of indices: index of needle string found or an empty matrix if no match found.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: For each entry of haystack, grep searches if at least a string in needle which matches a substring. The haystack entries index where at least a match has been found are returned in the row output argument. The optional which output argument gives the index of first string of needle found.

When using the third parameter flag="r", the needle is expected to be a regular expression string. In this case, grep uses the needle as a regular expression and compares it against haystack according to the regular expressions rules. See the regexp function for details about regular expressions.
